alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Greenbrier, Summers and Monroe Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 445 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alderson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... Alderson... Peterstown... and Union. In addition to this thunderstorm, other thunderstorms were redeveloping just north of Beckley, West Virginia. These storms are also tracking to the east and may contain gusty winds and very heavy rain. Much of Greenbrier County, and into northern Summers and Monroe counties of West Virginia, will continue to receive periods of heavy rain through 6:00 AM, EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with some of these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
